items.details:
Great job today, everyone!

You all did an amazing job on Sports Day — it looked like you had so much fun! Remember, it’s not about winning, it’s about taking part and doing your best.

Next week, we have two tests:

Math on Tuesday
Grammar on Thursday
Please review all your previous homework and make sure your Math “Red” pages are finished.

For your journal, you have two choices:

Bookaween
Sports Day

You can choose one topic or write about both — it’s up to you1

Reading

The story this week is 'Weird Friends" 

Please watch the video until you understand the story.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZdYQdzhaurc

The spelling test is next Friday!

predators
protection
immune
species
emerges
cluster
sea anemone
tentacles
rhino
egret
blind
antennae 
detect
flee
pod

Extra reading ( I have added some new stories)

TO IMPROVE READING AND EMBED LEARNING, YOU SHOULD BE LOGGING INTO READWORKS

Please go to ReadWorks and complete some of the stories assigned. They will help you with your work in school and also improve your overall reading.

Go to www.readworks.org/student 

Enter our class code YU6GQ2
Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it

Korean (MONDAY)

Pages 103-105 and 137-139
Also finish to page 45

Social Studies
We need to make good progress on our World Heritage Day project this weekend. Ideas should start taking shape — make sure you have your photos printed and your games organized.

There isn’t much time left, so please take some time to prepare something fun and interesting with your group.

There isn’t much other homework, so please make sure to focus on your World Heritage project.

HAVE A GREAT WEEKEND!
